org.mike.sort

Class ParallelQuicksort<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mike.sort.ParallelQuicksort<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - 

    public final class ParallelQuicksort<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class encapsulates a Parallel Quicksort algorithm. In practice, it appears to scale well up to a small number of processors when run against a list with millions of elements that consist of a diverse set of values. Multi-process executions have been demonstrated to be considerably faster than the standard Collecions.sort(), which is implemented as a sequential mergesort, under the conditions described above. The algorithm sorts the given list 'in-place,' however a stack is utilized in lieu of recursion. The bounds pushed onto this stack do represent a small amount of additional memory required to perform the sort. Being based on Quicksort, lists that are mostly sorted, and lists with low variance of values will run extremely slow.
    Author:
    broadbear

    • Method Detail

      • sort

        public static <T> void sort(int P,
            int minPartition,
            java.util.List<T> a,
            java.util.Comparator<? super T> c)
        Sorts the given List based on the given Comparator instance.
        Parameters:
        P - the number of child threads to instantiate.
        minPartition - the smallest run of list elements to sort via the parallel quicksort algorithm. Runs smaller than this number are sorted via a sequential insertion sort.
        a - the list to sort. The given list is sorted 'in-place.'
        c - a comparator instance to determine the sort order of individual elements.

      • sort

        public static <T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>> void sort(int P,
                                                    int minPartition,
                                                    java.util.List<T> a)
        Sorts the given List based on the list elements' natural ordering. The list elements must inherit the Comparable interface.
        Parameters:
        P - the number of child threads to instantiate.
        minPartition - the smallest run of list elements to sort via the parallel quicksort algorithm. Runs smaller than this number are sorted via a sequential insertion sort.
        a - the list to sort. The given list is sorted 'in-place.'

      • sort

        public static <T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>> void sort(java.util.List<T> a)
        Sorts the given List based on the list elements' natural ordering. The list elements must inherit the Comparable interface. This method uses Java Runtime to configure the sort algorithm to use a number of processes equal to processors reported by the system.
        Parameters:
        a - the list to sort. The given list is sorted 'in-place.'
